abstract: After months of complicated negotiations, officials from Bank of America, Citigroup and JPMorgan Chase have agreed on the structure of a backup fund for credit markets, said a person involved in discussions.
snippet: After months of complicated negotiations, officials from Bank of America, Citigroup and JPMorgan Chase have agreed on the structure of a backup fund for credit markets, said a person involved in discussions.
lead_paragraph: The country’s three biggest banks have reached agreement on the structure of a backup fund of at least $75 billion to help stabilize credit markets, a person involved in the discussions said yesterday, ending nearly two months of complicated negotiations against a worsening economic backdrop.

headline.main: Banks Said to Agree on Credit Backup Fund
headline.print_headline: Top Banks Said to Reach Agreement on Fund to Help Stabilize Credit Markets
